questiontext.text:
Exercise

Write out the terms of the Fourier series for the periodic signal given by \[ f(t) = t^2,\] \[ f(t + 2) = f(t).\] You should give the constant term \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) and each term corresponding to \( n = 1\) to \( n = 6\):

[[input:ans1]][[validation:ans1]]

generalfeedback.text:
Since \(T = 2\) the form of the Fourier series is \[ \dfrac{a_0}{2} + \sum_{n=1}^\infty \left\{ a_n \cos (n\pi t) + b_n \sin (n\pi t) \right\} \] where \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \displaystyle{ \int _{-1}^{1} }f(t) \cos (n\pi t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 0, 1, 2, \dots \\ b_n &= \displaystyle{ \int _{-1}^{1} } f(t) \sin (n\pi t) \hspace{0.15cm}dt \hspace{1cm} n = 1, 2, \dots \end{align} \] Because the function is non-negative there will be a constant term. The constant term will be \(\dfrac{a_0}{2}\) where \( a_0 = \displaystyle{ \int_{-1}^{1}} t^2 \hspace{0.15cm}dt = \dfrac{2}{3} \).

For \(n = 1, 2, 3, \dots , \) we have \[ \begin{align} a_n &= \displaystyle{ \int_{-1}^{1} } t^2 \cos (n\pi t) \hspace{0.15cm} dt \\ &= \left[ \dfrac{t^2}{n\pi} \sin (n\pi t) \right] _{-1}^{1} - \dfrac{2}{n\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{-1}^{1} } t \sin n\pi t \hspace{0.15cm} dt \\ &= 0 - \dfrac{2}{n\pi} \left\{ \left[ - \dfrac{t}{n\pi} \cos n \pi t \right] _{-1}^1 + \dfrac{1}{n\pi} \displaystyle{ \int_{-1}^{1} } \cos n\pi t \hspace{0.15cm} dt \right\} \\ &= -\dfrac{2}{n\pi} \left\{ -\dfrac{1}{n\pi} \cos n\pi - \dfrac{1}{n\pi} \cos (-n\pi) + \dfrac{1}{n^2\pi^2} \left[ \sin n\pi t \right]_{-1}^1 \right\} \\ &= \dfrac{4}{n^2\pi^2} \cos n\pi \end{align} \] As the function is even, we have \(b_n = 0\).

Thus the series is given by \[ \begin{align} f(t) &= \dfrac{1}{3} - \dfrac{4}{\pi^2} \cos \pi t + \dfrac{1}{\pi^2} \cos 2\pi t - \dfrac{4}{9\pi^2} \cos 3\pi t \\ &+ \dfrac{1}{4\pi^2} \cos 4\pi t - \dfrac{4}{25\pi^2} \cos 5\pi t + \dfrac{1}{9\pi^2} \cos 6\pi t + \dots \end{align} \]
